description: Change of use of unit from B2 general industrial use to Class B8 warehousing & distribution with ancilary B1 offices
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of  five years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | Any machinery audible outside the premises must be designed to an acoustic standard not exceeding Noise Rating NR35 measured or calculated at the nearest horizontal or vertical boundary of the nearest affected dwelling, whichever is the closer.   REASON:  To protect the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers. | There shall be no deliveries to and from the premises outside 0700 hours and 1900 hours on Mondays to Saturdays and not at all on Sundays or Bank or Public Holidays.  REASON:  In the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties. | There shall be no subdivision of the existing building into smaller, separate units.  REASON:  In the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties. | The areas shown on the approved plans 2545/2 as parking, access, loading,  unloading and manoeuvring shall be kept clear at all times and used for these purposes only. 	 REASON:	To ensure that adequate parking and servicing space is available within the site. | If the warehousing is to involve the use of any refrigeration or air conditioning plant, details should be submitted to demonstrate that any machienry audible outside the premises will be designed to satisfy an acoustic standard not exceeding (NR35 Leq (5 mins), 2300-0700 hours) and (NR40 Leq (1 hr) 0700-2300 hrs) (weekdays) (weekends), measured or calculated at 1m from the nearest facade of the nearest affected noise sensitive premises.  REASON:  In the interests of the living conditions of nearby properies.
